markdownRemark.html:
Useful code snippets for daily work with Git tool.

  1. Setting default text editor:

    • Sublime Text:

      git config --global core.editor "subl -n -w"

    • Atom:

      git config --global core.editor "atom --wait"

    • Nano:

      git config --global core.editor "nano -w"

    • Vim:

      git config --global core.editor "vim"

    • Notepad++ (Win):

      git config --global core.editor "'C:/Program Files (x86)/Notepad++/notepad++.exe' -multiInst -notabbar -nosession -noPlugin"

  2. Commit messages overwriting:

    • Only recent, local commit:

      git commit --amend

    • Only recent, already pushed commit:

      git commit --amend
git push origin master --force

    • Several local commits:

      git rebase -i HEAD~commits_count
# select 'reword' option for commits, you want to ovewrite,
# save file, and then write new commit messages.

    • Several already pushed commits:

      # same as in snippet before, and then:
git push origin master --force

  3. Revert changes in remote:

    git reset --hard HEAD~commits_count
# make changes, commit and then:
git push origin master --force

  4. Detached HEAD: we are in commit not attached to any branch. To go back to previous commit:

    git checkout -

  5. Checkout file from different commit:

    git checkout wskaznik_commita -- file_name

  6. Cherry pick:

    # mark commit with lightwight tag:
git tag tag_name
# switch to destination branch and pick changes:
git checkout branch_name
git cherry-pick tag_name

  7. Tags:

    • Adding lightweight tag:

      git tag tag_name [commit]

    • Adding heavy tag (contains date, author and message):

      git tag tag_name [commit] -a -m message

    • Removing tag:

      git tag -d tag_name

    • Displaying heavy tag details:

      git show

  8. Fast-forward: copy commits to master without creating merge commit. To disable this feature:

    git merge --no-ff
